blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 nats-server: golang: net/http: An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests [fedora-all]
CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

long_desc.thetext:
An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.

https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/L_3rmdT0BMU/m/yZDrXjIiBQAJ
https://pkg.go.dev/vuln/GO-2022-1144
https://go.dev/cl/455717
https://go.dev/issue/56350
https://go.dev/cl/455635

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 nats-server: golang: net/http: An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests [fedora-all]
CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

long_desc.thetext:
An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

long_desc.thetext:
An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.

https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/L_3rmdT0BMU/m/yZDrXjIiBQAJ
https://pkg.go.dev/vuln/GO-2022-1144
https://go.dev/cl/455717
https://go.dev/issue/56350
https://go.dev/cl/455635

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41717 nats-server: golang: net/http: An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 nats-server: golang: net/http: An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

long_desc.thetext:
An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.

https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/L_3rmdT0BMU/m/yZDrXjIiBQAJ
https://pkg.go.dev/vuln/GO-2022-1144
https://go.dev/cl/455717
https://go.dev/issue/56350
https://go.dev/cl/455635

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2161274,2163280

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======
